Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice. The staff was lacking in terms of helping with luggage and check-in, however the hotel itself was great. Our room was very nice and the bed was comfortable. The shower head had low pressure, but could be adjust I found out the last night of my stay! The lobby restaurant was delicious! Go for the junk food platter. The rooftop pool was very nice and relaxing. The hotel was a great location for accessing the different parts of LA Live.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER HAD A WORSE EXPERIENCE WITH A HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: BERTTLES
Reviews.Content: I stayed here this past weekend with 3 other friends. As soon as we pull up, $40 charge for parking and having access to your car during your stay to take it in and out. Upon check in, we're told we have to pay a $50 deposit for the room, even though we spoke to the hotel numerous times about the total costs, nobody mentioned this. But we completely understood and we were told the money would be returned immediately after check-out. We make our way to the room and as soon as we get there, a group right behind us, that had just checked in as well, had been given the same room. We're then reassigned to a room that wasn't nearly as nice, but we didn't complain. We then learn about the $15 dollar charge for WiFi, but definitely remembered the hotel offering free internet for their guests on their website. Then, check-out. Complete disaster. Since it was a few of us staying together, I paid for the deposit and one paid for the room. Apparently when we checked in, the $50 was a charge instead of a hold. So on the other card they had charged the remainder of the costs. Which screwed the plan my friends and I had. They try to fix it, and they charge the full amount on the intended card, and tell me it may be a week before I get my $50 back. EVEN THOUGH WE WERE TOLD I COULD GET IT IMMEDIATELY AFTER CHECK-OUT. Our group is obviously irritated at this point, but their employees did little to nothing to help the situation or explain what they were doing with all these charges. They tell me that I can get my $50 back if I call my bank and tell them to release the money to my account, which I shortly did after, but the bank tells me I'm pretty much SOL because the Marriott needs to handle this first. I go online to check what the status of this charge was, and learn that another $47 charge from the Marriott has been made. I called the Marriott several times trying to resolve the issue, but everybody was just telling me they don't know why certain charges were made but they assured me it was being credited the money back and it was just my bank that needed to release the money. My bank again, tells me they have no control over the money and suggest I wait a few days for the money. The $47 was deposited back into my account the next day, but not the $50. Again, I call the Marriott to find out what's going on and they tell me THE SAME THING, that they've released the money. So I figure I would wait a little longer. Then today the $47 is taken out from account..... I'm soo done trying to figure out what the hell this place is doing. Cool place, cool room, but our stay and the employees were mediocre to say the least. I will not be returning nor do I encourage any future business for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Miracosta
Reviews.Content: We stayed at King Executive room for 2 nights. Had great corner window with views and extra large window in the bathroom. Everything was brand new, very stylish. Had love sofa, single sofa and work chair, plenty of room to play and work. Had great signal for internet, too. I considered to stay at the Ritz but Rita wasn't abailable so I chose JW Marriott. It was more than $100 cheaper for the same size room and I was very happy about it. Can't wait to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot”
Reviews.Author: Daylove
Reviews.Content: Stay two night in this hip hotel in the heart of LA. Locations is great(daytime) with everything you need in walking distance. Comfortable bed, nice flat screen TV, clean, spacious, decent room service quality(a bit pricey) and good choice of restaurants inside this hotel and in the adjacent Ritz Carlton(hotels are connected). Customer service was top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property - Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: ACLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice property in a nice and central location of downtown Los Angeles. The valet parking was efficient and friendly (a little pricey at $40), as was check-in. Staff was friendly and helpful. We had a very nice room with a view of the swimming pool. The room was clean and spacious with a very nice bathroom. The shower had great water pressure with hot-hot-hot water (which I loved). My only critique would be that while our room overlooked the pool, it also looked out onto the Ritz Carlton as well as the Nokia Center. This itself was not a problem - however, both of these buildings are very lit up at night (with blue and red lighting) and the drapes in the room were not heavy enough to block out the light. Thus, quite a bit of light crept in and the room was not fully dark. That may not be an issue for some people, but I feel it's worth a mention. The only reason I do not give it 5 stars is because of what I mentioned above about the lighting - AND - I do not consider this hotel to be a 5 star property (like the Four Seasons or Ritz), and I also did not utilize amenities such as bar, restaurant, swimming pool, concierge, etc. We paid right about $200 - I consider that to be a decent price for the quality of this property - I believe the rooms sometimes go for in excess of $300+ at which point I would probably stay at the Ritz because I don't believe this hotel warrants a rate of over $300 per night. In summary, we had a good experience and would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Functional business hotel”
Reviews.Author: K-Posse
Reviews.Content: The title says a lot. Location is good. Hotel's exterior, the entrance and the restaurant area are fresh. The rooms are different and do not match the looks of the hotel (bit musty). Wireless is on and off. Staff is professional and not exceptionally kind. I will only go back to this place when offered a great deal and if I need be in that area.

Reviews.Title: “I really liked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pips_14
Reviews.Content: My husband was on a business trip that took us to LA. Â It was my first time to this part of California and I didn't know what to expect for a downtown location. Luckily I really liked this hotel. The check in/out desk is right as you walk in; the lobby is beautiful and has a very smooth flow to it. Â Valet parking was quick and easy and was also right at the front door. Â  There are a lot of places to eat within walking distance. Â LA live is literally right beside the hotel as is a Starbucks that opens early! (which was great if your from the East coast)Â  The room we had was a corner suite that was just lovely! It had super cute furniture and a very large bathroom with great decor.Â  The staff was friendly and seemed very attentive. Â The hotel is clean and maintained.Â All in all, hotel was very pleasant.Â

Reviews.AuthorLocation: San Antonio De Belen, Costa Rica
Reviews.Title: “Location is not everything.. Book the Ritz instead!!”
Reviews.Author: 1txgal
Reviews.Content: Don't stay at Marriott. Online booking price totally misleading. $40 parking. $25 rollaway. Doesn't include a pillow and blanket. Front desk a d manager really do 't care. Rewards member since '91 and they just don't care. Just book the Ritz who will charge you but will give you great customer service. Manager took 4 hours to call and didn't leave much of a message. Guess i will call tomorrow and see if they care. Next step i will call the GM. Marriott is BAD,BAD,BAD.

Reviews.Title: “Very good utilitarian hotel”
Reviews.Author: bighead33
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days on a LA vacation. The location and service was excellent for going to the staples center and for taking the highway to other locations. Everyone was very attentive and courtious and would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Nice location in the middle of LA”
Reviews.Author: jerrythetraveler
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I stayed here at the JW Marriott at LA Live. The first time was during a trip to the Emmy's. The hotel was very new and the service was lack luster at best. I was concerned that the hotel had adopted a stance that they were a LA destination property and that if you were staying at the Marriott and not the adjacent Ritz Carlton, you did not need good service. I did not write a review of the property though, as I figured with the Emmy's going on next door and the hotel being newly opened, I would give them a pass. On my second visit, this past week for the Espy's, I was pleasantly surprised. A lot of the sharpness I experienced at the hotel last time was replaced with a very professional tone. Also as an added bonus, a lot of the tenant space that had been mostly vacant has filled in, although the surrounding area is still mostly vacant. The parking is not very secure (open to the public), but unless you are worried about that... valet is not required. The parking is located beneath the hotel and very close (I Valet). I can not see my self staying at this property if I was not attending an event at LA Live or at the hotel, as you are not near any other LA attractions, but it is very convenient to the interstate if you can get a good rate and have a car. The hotel is on par with the adjacent Ritz. I have stayed at both properties and although the Ritz is clearly a step up. It is not worth the additional 200 a night. I was able to easily secure a nightly rate of $189.00, when booking in advance. This property tends to nail you, when you do not plan in advance, even if the hotel is empty. The concierge level is available Sunday Night through Friday Morning, but I was too busy to use it, other than swiping a few bottled waters. So if you have biz downtown near the Staple Center or LA Live and are not looking for warm-fuzzy, this hotel stands up with the best of the downtown LA hotel options. The hotel is all that a JW Marriott should be, but not as charming as the LA Biltmore.

Reviews.Title: “JW Marriott Disappoints”
Reviews.Author: BizTravelerDeluxe
Reviews.Content: I'm told that the JW Marriott is to "experience a new dimension of luxury in a hotel" - that's actually directly from their website. Unfortunately it was anything but. While the "exquisite architectural detail" was ok, the service was one of the worst experiences I've had in a 5 star hotel. Let me list the issues: 1. We arrived late at night and I was standing with my wife and children and a large amount of luggage for about 12 minutes as no one from the hotel actually came and asked if we needed help with our bags (there was no one else on the driveway!). When they finally arrived by the time I checked in and got to the room it was close to 45 minutes. 2. As I was arriving very late to a suite with my family I had specifically requested that a cot to be set up prior to my arrival so I could quickly get my youngest to sleep - nope. When I asked at check-in a vacant stare was my response. I had to book and chase three times before they came - with a roll away bed and NOT a cot?!?! 3. They have a bar fridge with nothing in it. Ok, this is fairly standard for the US hotels, but when I ordered room service they got it wrong. First, the bottle of wine I ordered was changed because â€œthey are changing their wine listâ€� and the second time they left off an order 4. I went to breakfast and I was standing at the entrance waiting for someone to seat me in case this was the requirement (there is no sign by the way). After about 5 minutes I went and sat down. A lady came over to me and I asked to order and she said something to the effect, â€œoh, youâ€™re sitting there, you walked straight past meâ€� . 5. They have some funky pool thing going on for non-hotel guests. My wife went for a swim about 10:30 am and there were a bunch of drunk idiots jumping into the pool fully clothed multiple times and the staff did nothing about it. Then another time a bunch of near naked FAT people down from the pool were standing in the reception area being very loud (as they were drunk) and treating the small water/biscuit bar (that JW Marriott has there for convenience) as a buffet lunch?!? 6. They forgot one day to service my room?!? And had the gall to tell me "oh, you must have left the "do not disturb" sign on your door"!?!? In short, very disappointing and I hope I never have to go to another Marriott in my lifeâ€¦.

Reviews.Title: “Not your average Marriott.”
Reviews.Author: WTravelerSeattle
Reviews.Content: If you were headed to Los Angeles for a convention at the LA Convention Center, look no further for a hotel. This hotel is walking distance (5 min). It also seems that this hotel was designed for the business professional or "suit" that is only use to staying at the best when travelling for business. No this is not the Holiday Inn or La Quinta, and if you are used to staying at those other properties for business, then this is not for you. The front desk is right as you enter so you don't have to go through a maze to find it. Behind the front desk you will find a well-lighted, spacious grand lobby that is setup for easy networking with other business professionals. There is a coffee shop, two bar areas, and a restaurant all located at the lobby floor. The rooms are clean, new, and modern with all the latest amenities like a large flat screen with HD channels, to crisp goose down pillows and comforters. There is a large desk with easily accessible outlets to plug in all your devices. You do however have to pay for wireless connectivity... The bathroom lighting takes a little getting used to, however you never run out of bathroom amenities (shampoo, etc.). There is a large pool to do laps and spacious gym for that early morning workout. The hotel restaurant is spendy for the selection and quality, however you will find a few good alternatives right outside the rear entrance - Wolfgang Puck & Katsuya (sushi). Care to watch a game while in town? Staple Center, home of Kobe Bryant and the LA Lakers, is right across the street from this hotel. What else could have been a good addition? The Wall Street Journal outside my front door every morning...but I guess that this may have required a Marriott membership.

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel on the south end of downtown, near the Raleys market. Take a walk north to see the LA Architecture”
Reviews.Author: 2Midwest
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a convention. On the south end of downtown now re-named South Park. New hotel. Very clean. Comfortable bed. Choose the rooms facing the LA Live to avoid the street noise. Walk to the nearby Raleys Market for great in room food and beverage. Walk to the Y or Golds Gym for a full service gym. Walk north to see the great LA arcitecture. Skip the high end expensive chains near the hotel. Yes, LA Live with its huge neon billboards is bizarre and annoying. But as a finnicky traveller, I liked everything about this hotel and the staff was very accomodating. Convention rate no bargain but I like new and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Infested!!!”
Reviews.Author: DoctorGrant
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were two of the earliest to stay in this hotel. The hotel itself is pleasent and well situated, but I was extremely surprised to wake up with bite marks all over my legs! My wife's legs did not show any bites, but, as a doctor, I know the high dose Benadryl she was taking for allergies would diminish or wipe out her body's response to any bites. I took photos of the bite marks and sent them to their administration. I had initial conversation with their reps, but after that, I was essentially disregarded by them, not getting return phone calls despite repeated efforts. They showed little interest in the matter and didn't follow it up at all. My dermatologist friend confirmed that the bite marks are typical of bed bugs. I don't understand how a relatively new hotel could already have bed bugs. And if they did have bed bugs, how they could show such little concern about the matter. This place cannot be trusted when it comes to health matters. There was no show of consideration or compensation on any level, and this hotel isn't cheap, at least when it comes to them taking money from your wallet. I have had several other opportunities to chose hotels in LA since then, and have always avoided going back to this hotel given the horrible experience and their complete lack of acknowledgement of it. I can't stomach going back and they don't deserve the patronage. Be warned!

Reviews.Title: “Great Convention Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Khyron82
Reviews.Content: I was in the L.A. Live area for an annual convention over the 4th of July weekend, and chose this hotel for it's proximity to all of the events in the area (saw the construction progress with each convention starting in 2008, so I was naturally curious about staying there). Excellent experience from check-in to check-out. My room partner had a problem hooking up his laptop to the in-room television monitor, and two maintenece men showed up promptly (one to diagnose the problem, the other to bring the missing cable that the in-room instructions said was needed to do the hook-up). The bathroom had to have been the largest, space-wise, I've ever experience (stayed at several hotels in the L.A. Live area for the conventions over the past 4 years). My room partners really like the free wireless internet in the lobby area (great atmosphere and comfortable surroundings). The concierge (Joy) was very helpful in arranging our return airport shuttle, and when it didn't show up on our July 5th departure day, the concierge on duty that morning got on phone and hooked us up with a new one (the original driver apparently missed all his L.A. Live hotel runs that morning). On the minor quibbles side, there didn't seem to be a fan to vent the bathroom and since there was a large LCD screen on the front of the Ritz Carlton Tower, the Marriott rooms facing South (toward the Staples and L.A. Convention Center) got a nightly light show, whether they wanted it or not (a lot of BLADE RUNNER jokes were made). The curtains didn't do a good job of keeping all the light out, so eye-masks were necessary for those who were sensitive to such things (I personally slept like a log). Also, there was a dance party going on at the Pool Level on Friday evening that got a little noisy for for those of us on the 15th floor, but it was only for a couple of hours. Due to the convention event schedule, I didn't have time to use the Spa or Swimming Pool, so I couldn't rate those. Plenty of food options nearby at L.A. Live and beyond, so unfortunately no ratings for the Restaurant and Room Service. The expresso bar seemed very popular. If I attend a future convention in the area, I'll definitely choose this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressive. Love the hotel and location.”
Reviews.Author: learengi
Reviews.Content: When I walked into the spacious lobby I was instantly impressed. The hotel is beautiful with a lot of wide open space. After check in the room was large with a view of LA. I went to the pool bar, which also had a view, had a few drinks, then walked to LA Live. There is a good selection of restaurants within walking distance. There also just happened to be the FLoyd Mayweather-Victor Ortiz pre-fight conference right in the plaza. Great location. Great hotel. It will serve all your downtown LA needs and then some. The staff was courteous and attentive, the food was decent.

Reviews.Title: “Accomodations and So Much More”
Reviews.Author: ingridfisher
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the pleasure of staying at this hotel during a recent business trip. We were pleasantly surprised from the moment we checked in until the time we left four days later. We used a lot of space at the hotel during the business trip. Our group gathered in the area right outside the restaurant on many occasions and the chairs and couches were very comfortable. We also used several banquet rooms on the second floor and the size was always adequate. There were also random areas with chairs and couches that really made it nice for entertaining without having to go back to our room. The rooms were adequate for entertaining two people in addition to my husband and I. The furniture in the rooms is very modern and comfortable and we can not say enough about the bed. It was very inviting and we were relaxed and refreshed every morning. The extras in the room, bathrooms and common areas made it the perfect location for this business trip and we would definitely consider it if we return to Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “J.W. Marriott - VERY nice!!!”
Reviews.Author: BagbosRichmond_VA
Reviews.Content: My wife and stayed at the JW at L.A. Live a few months ago. Our flight got cancelled out of LAX so we decided to make the most of it in L.A. Th hotel is gorgeous and well appointed. The bars and restaurants on site are very nice. The hotel is in the middle of it all. Great restaurants nearby and plenty to do within walking distance. Rooms are immaculate and the service is top notch. This is one of the best J.W. Marriott's we have been to and we have been to most of them. I would highly recommend the hotel to anyone looking for luxuries at a good price!

Reviews.Title: “Best Birthday Ever”
Reviews.Author: genwithag215
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my 25th birthday weekend. The Bad: Checking in Friday night was a MESS because there were at least 2 conventions going on with people staying in that hotel, and we arrived just behind 2 buses of bicyclists who all had to check in. We also didn't get the type of room we requested, even though we booked through the Marriott website. I would expect that if we had booked through Expedia or something. They said they'd send up a roll away. No real apology for the super long wait or the room, but ok. LA Live has a lot of great restaurants! Ate at the Yard House which was delish and never disappoints. Room service was frankly not worth the price. I ordered the All-American breakfast. The "eggs" were clearly not real egg and weren't cooked how I had asked. Sausage was like that weird, hard, English sausage. Bacon was the 2 smallest pieces of bacon I've ever seen. The potatoes were good. My friend had eggs benedict, which she did enjoy, but wasn't as hot as she would have liked. There is a Ralph's within walking distance from the hotel (also has free parking w/ validation below if you'd like to drive), so I would suggest stopping there and getting something to eat. Also, overnight parking is $40 a night. Expedia and the Marriott sometimes offer packages for about $20 extra a night that include parking and a resort credit, so keep an eye out for that. Only bad part of the pool is that about 4pm ish the sun starts to dip behind the building so you have to move to the spa because you will freeze in the pool. The Good: Saturday we spent most of the day at the pool which was surprisingly not crowded. The Marriott has a salt water pool which is so much gentler on your skin. Really great. My new favorite bartender is Jos (like Jose without the e), who made me a delicious watermelon margarita with real watermelon. Oddly, the pool bar doesn't have a blender, so daquiris and the like weren't an option. If you go to the bar, make sure you talk to Jos! He is SO AWESOME! He'll take the time to find you a drink you like. The rooms are super comfortable and spacious. Rooms look exactly like they do on the website and the standard rooms are more spacious than I expected. They also have this cool feature where if you bring a laptop and a HDMI cable, you can plug it into the desk and watch movies on TV. The rooms are also equipped with an iHome which I love for plugging in my iPod and playing dj. The standard feather pillows are a bit too nice and soft for me. So if you like a little height, I'd suggest calling housekeeping for a non-feather pillow. Otherwise, the beds are great! We didn't visit on this trip, but the burgers at the LA Market Restaurant in the lobby are pricey but TO DIE FOR! And the pretzel bread they serve while you wait is SO GOOD. Overall- This hotel is PRICEY. Expect to spend some money. To cut costs, venture out of the LA Live area. There are some really great restaurants and bars around. But for special occasions when you don't mind spending a bit out of the norm, this hotel is great!

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel”
Reviews.Author: atlanta14
Reviews.Content: Some new hotels show their youth by inexperience, poor service and working out the kinks - not this one. It felt new in all of the best ways - cleanliness, unique lay out and design, comfortable rooms, etc.

Reviews.Title: “VERY SWANKY UPSCALE HOTEL, RESONABLE PRICE”
Reviews.Author: loveshakur
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel on our short trip to LA. I loved the room, it was cozy and swanky at the same time and we had a great view of the city. There are 3 bars in the hotel that seemed to be very popular. We also went to the posh cocktail lounge adjacent to the hotel in the Ritz Carlton but found that to be WAY out of our price range. The Pool Bar was closed by 10pm which we found to be disappointing but with SO many restaurants and bars nearby it wasn't hard to find something else to do. Everyone will tell you that you basically have to use the Valet service which is 40 dollars per night but we found a lot 1block away that was 10 dollars a night, we wish we would have used instead. So look around, you don't have to settle for the overpriced hotel garage. All in all it was a great room, classy hotel with hospitable service.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best”
Reviews.Author: BocaDeb
Reviews.Content: This place is awesome, very modern, clean, quiet and large rooms. Travelling alone for business, I felt safe as no one can gain access to a floor without the access card. I enjoyed the restaurant for breakfast as well, the food was a step above the norm, with a wider selection for the health conscious diner. I did have to ask the front desk how to get the faucet in the bathroom lobby to work as the sensor was in an unusual location. It is conveniently located to other dining as well.

Reviews.Title: “Fun place to stay during the holidays”
Reviews.Author: dawggirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed for several nights in December for the University of Wasington's basketball games at USC/UCLA (wins) and football game in San Diego (Holiday Bowl win over Nebraska). It was the team hotel for TCU Football who were playing in the Rose Bowl, AND the Clippers and Lakers played while we were there. The place was packed with activity and something to do/see at all hours of the day and night. The weather wasn't good, but used the pool anyway - very nice sun deck, pool area. No service out there this time of year, at least not while we were there. The room itself was spacious and comfortable. The bed was nice too, very comfortable. The room was plenty big for me and my son to share, spread out and not be in each others way. The bathroom is huge and there are other things you'd expect from a JW Marriott - robes, etc. Overall, it's not as luxurious as some JW's I've stayed at (Scottsdale, Oahu), but nice overall. The staff were very busy during the whole time we were here but found that the front desk staff most helpful in giving advice on what to do, where to go, eat, etc. The concierge was useless both times we asked him for information. Room service was good, big portions and quick service. Unlike other reviewers, I liked the location... not too far from anything really (if you like to drive, which I do). Went all over LA, Chinatown, Hollywood, Westwood, beaches, The Grove, etc. Wasn't a bad location to just walk around in, even at night. LA Live has been redone and there are good restaurants and things to do. Was surprised on a Saturday night though that things closed relatively early (10 p.m.). Didn't use bell service but valet was good; they were super busy but very efficient. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely hands down the WORST hotel I have EVER been to. DO NOT COME HERE.”
Reviews.Author: gkano
Reviews.Content: FIrst of all, this place seems nice but it is absolutely disgusting and they have bed bugs!! The rooms are ok but we were bit all over in the middle of the night and the bathroom was not clean. Also, I would not have come here if we weren't here for a convention. The place is in the middle of downtown LA with nothing around but to spend money at their crappy bar. We had come for business and almost HALF of the reservations we had booked MONTHS in advance weren't saved. Clients were very upset. The front desk kept saying they couldn't do anything about it. They were completely unorganized. They claimed we wouldn't have to pay for parking which we DID for $40 a night. The customer service was absolutely horrible! I've never seen such ignorance. We were trying to be so polite the entire time even about complaining about our room. When we were checking out we had boxes that we sent a car to pick up and they wouldn't let us keep them in the lobby or outside to wait for our car! Then when the car came around they wouldn't help us when we had asked politely! I would rather sleep on the street then ever ever step foot in that place again. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone. It completely ruined our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Hotel...but...”
Reviews.Author: jxenadu
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, but a few weird issues with it. The showers are obviously made for 6'7" basketball players, almost impossible to reach the shower head. The phones are crazy, I couldn't figure out how to make a call to the front desk without it being on speakerphone! But, everything was beautiful and clean, and since we were there for the American Idol Finale, lots of celebrities walking around! Also, William the bartender was awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Nice But Not Quite JW Quality”
Reviews.Author: des104joy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a nice, nice location, trendy, but didn't work for me. The rooms were okay but not great! I've stayed in nicer SpringHill Suites. The staff were impersonal. The pool was underwhelming. The conference space was okay but not great. Disappointed by the valet only parking. The parking staff upstairs and downstairs where the friendliest folks in the hotel. Overall this didn't feel like JW Quality to me. That said, I love marriott resorts, but would not have stayed here unless I was attending a conference at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy”
Reviews.Author: thebear59
Reviews.Content: We had stayed here on business last summer and found it too trendy. The front desk check in doesn't look like any other hotel. The problem with these new trendy hotels is that they seem to be cold and lack character with all that glass. This is personal taste and doesn't reflect the service of the hotel. The location was great and walking distance to all attractions and restaurants. There is a famous restaurant that serves breakfast all day long and is the only restaurant open 365 days never close within a block of the hotel. Our rooms were clean and the lounge area offered free WIFI. You would have to pay for it in the room. The hotel has a large ballroom which held our dinner event.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely disappointing”
Reviews.Author: kcseaf
Reviews.Content: Arrived just before 3 pm with a confirmed reservation since October 2010 for double beds. The hotel could only give us a room with a king size bed and then a promise with a room change for the next day. The first room was the smallest, dirtiest room I believe in the hotel. The bathroom was lacking enough towels, only had a shower and the shower floor was dirty. Having stayed at the hotel last year we were amazed how worn it seemed- from the service, the rooms, to the presentation of flowers in the lobby. The second room wasn't much better- dirty rug, bathroom walls, bent lamp and an unusual shower curtain- two uneven halves and colors not matching anything in Marriott that we have seem before. It appeared that excellence is not what this hotel is all about.

Reviews.Title: “Sexy Hotel that was stunning and luxurious”
Reviews.Author: NatalieAnnGarcia
Reviews.Content: So fresh and so clean. LA Live is Vegas Hotels meeting LA life with a lobby of utter opulence and luxury, this hotel is a great place to stay at, but also grab drinks and people watch. I stayed here, while I was in town for a conference and it truly is a nice hotel. That same weekend was the American Music Awards, so a decent amount of people watching was amusing as we sat in the lobby. The rooms are extremely spacious. It has the typical fancy stuff now. Ipod hook-ups, flat screens, big bathrooms, an all around luxury. The staff was excellent and kind. The valet service is on point. Word of advice: Call in advance and say you are on your way down. Even if it takes you a bit of time, that's ok. That way, your car is ready and waiting for you. This hotel is pretty sweet, and would definitely recommend staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown location”
Reviews.Author: brigette_garbin
Reviews.Content: We went to both Lakers and Dodgers games, so the downtown location of the JW Marriott was perfect for us. It was also only about a $30 taxi ride to other areas such as West Hollywood. Room was lovely and spacious, very modern interiors. Staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, location and Facilities”
Reviews.Author: malbahari
Reviews.Content: If you can get a good rate at this hotel, do not hesitate to book...Great Service and location...

Reviews.Title: “Downtown luxury”
Reviews.Author: Chris_Battersea
Reviews.Content: Had to stay downtown LA for an event at LA Live. Great hotel. Big rooms...great design. Great service. Convenient parking. Espresso bar in lobby. Excellent pool and lounge area on 4th floor and cool vibe. Not as pretentious at the Ritz Carlton, more upmarket than a Hilton or Marriott. Beds were comfortable. Ipod dock station next to bed. Great towels, toiletries and fridge in room (no snacks/drinks - byob). excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “This is IT for downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: SpringT
Reviews.Content: Stayed only one night but the location is fab if your event or meeting is at the LA Convention Center or Staples Center. Just steps away. Food at the onsite restaurant is very good but they really need to redo the lunch menu - in trying to be different in their menu layout, they just ended up confusing the guests (and the wait staff for that matter). I tried to get in for breakfast, but there was such a long line at 9am that I gave up. This however appears to be true of most places in the LA Live zone on Sunday, so be prepared. I haven't had a bad experience at the JW's in the Marriott chain, and this one at LA Live is superb. The only downside is that because it is THAT close to the public arenas, they have a high volume of group traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Central location with great view of downtown”
Reviews.Author: forensicanthro10
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked in to this hotel for an alumni event at USC. We loved the room. The decor was trendy, beds comfortable, and the bathroom huge. The only thing was that in order to adjust the shower heads, we had to take a chair into the bathroom and stand on it to get it moved. We were just too short to reach! The bathroom soaps and conditioners were quite nice. Parking was a little more than we bargained for, but our stay at this property was fun. I think my favorite part was watching the 747 traffic to and from LAX from the 4th floor swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Bluehen94
Reviews.Content: We stayed a Thurs and Fri night in early April. Staff was great! We were upgraded to a junior suite which was huge! The concierge lounge was very nice and the pool was fantastic. We ordered a roll away bed which was promptly delivered. Staff even called to double-check that it was delivered. Parking onsite is only valet at $40 per day. 20% discount for hybrid vehicles.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL ESPECIALLY IF YOU FIND THE RIGHT PRICE!”
Reviews.Author: Huskies04
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a spectacular city hotel. It is especially convenient if you are doing anything in the LA LIVE area. Staples Center is right across the street. I was in town with my girlfriend for the Pac 10 tourney. I go every year, but this is the first time staying at the JW. I luckly got a good rate through my connections with the UW basketball team. The place was as good as I expected, the lobby is awesome, the rooms are very nice, the roottop pool is great. No complaints really other than the parking price (which has become normal with any hotel). The regular prices Ive seen for this hotel are so high that the extra parking fees are ridiculous. So if you find the right deal, I think you'll love staying at this JW for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful guest services”
Reviews.Author: kelmorris
Reviews.Content: I was staying at the JW for a conference, became ill on my second day and retreated to my room. Later that day I called down to guest services for some clean towels, I told them I had requested no housekeeping services because I was ill and wanted to rest, they asked if they could send up some soup. In a very short time, i had fresh towels as well as chicken soup, crackers and tea.They generously and unexpectedly comped the food and i felt "cared for". thank you JW @ LA Live!

Reviews.Title: “Sick Building Syndrome?”
Reviews.Author: fuzzyduck1
Reviews.Content: Just finished a conference at this hotel. In perfect health when I left home, within 12 hours of being at this hotel came down with a variety of cold/low grade flu symptoms. In the evenings we would leave the hotel for dinner, every time shortly after leaving felt much better, woke the next morning with symptoms returned. Just got home and feeling back to normal, no symptoms. I travel a fair amount for business and stay in a variety of hotels and this is the first time I have ever experienced something like this although had something similar 15 years ago over a period of a couple of years in an office where I worked. Could have been just bad timing with a cold but I will never stay in this hotel again and would suggest to anyone with a sensitivity to closed atmosphere buildings (there is no way to get fresh air to your room, windows are sealed) that they stay somewhere else. Side note, the showers here are not good, almost everything else in the hotel is reasonable, but for a deluxe hotel the showers are weak, more of a weak drizzle than a rainfall, no power behind it and so high it is a pain to try and readjust spray style or direction.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in a Lively Area”
Reviews.Author: Souris
Reviews.Content: This hotel opened 1 year ago (Feb. 2010) in the newly designed LA Live area near the Staples Center. We stayed here for three nights for a conference at the LA Convention Center, which is a short walk from the hotel. As Platinum Elite clients, we were upgraded to a top floor room (2170) and had access to the lovely concierge lounge. The room was very clean, beautifully decorated in a contemporary, yet comfortable style. It had everything one would find in a typical Marriott only more stylish â€“ very comfortable bed with duvet, lots of good lighting, including bedside reading light, contemporary sofa and contemporary, but comfortable chair, large armoire, fine toiletries. The bathroom was roomy, the sink very large and the walk-in shower very large. (There is no tub in this room). Tall people take notice. THIS is the hotel for you. The showerhead was so high that I (5â€™2â€�) could not reach to adjust it. With the Staples Center right next door, it is clear that this hotel caters to basketball players. The lobby is magnificent with two contemporary bars and a very good restaurant. Bottom line: this place is upscale â€œhip.â€� We appreciated the security of having to use your room key to use the elevator. All personnel â€“ front desk, valet, bellhop, restaurant staff, and housekeeping are friendly and welcoming. The restaurant was quite good with a contemporary American menu that had something for everyone â€“ soups, salads, small pizzas, main dishes, burgers, sandwiches, and small plates. Apart from the noisy lobby bar and loud music, we were very pleased with this hotel on all levels and highly recommend it. The LA Live area is not for everyone. We felt a bit over-stimulated from all the light beams, lighted billboards, crowds and hoop-la going on at that moment due to the PAC-10 at the Staples Center. It definitely is a lively area with a lot going on for visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Simply not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: MDouglasWray
Reviews.Content: My advice is to avoid this upholstered cesspool like the plague. Even though I was travelling on business, had a confirmed (and paid for) room, I was unable to check in without a credit card. After much dancing I got it arranged but corporate has no flexibility and no mercy - all for the sake of 'possible incidental charges' (there were none, I used none of the additional services, thanks Marriott!). The room, on entry seemed clean enough but on close inspection I found long black hairs in the bathroom sink (I have photos) and curly brown (pubic??) hairs on the shower soap dish. YUCK. Housekeeping eventually (1 hour+) showed up to reclean the bathroom, no apology from the non-english-speaking staff. While I waited I tried to get a snack and a drink. Drinks you can get - that's the ONLY vending there is in the entire building. $1.25 bottle of Coke in hand I checked the room service menu - $14.95 was the cheapest item, club sandwich. Nearly $15 for a SANDWICH? Unless it's delivered by a naked dancing girl that's too much. No, dancing girls not available. Attempted to have pizza delivered - only Pizza Hut apparently pays the kickback and is allowed to deliver there. $15 got a large pepperoni delivered (and was quite good). Tried to call home - cordless phone handset dead, despite 'charge' light. Corded phone would not reach desk area - also had a ring loud enough to startle me and no obvious control to turn down. Cheap and flimsy set to boot. Cinema-size television had extremely weak and very directional remote (cheap) that took several seconds per channel change (television signal obviously delivered via house computer network) and dropped out / broke up / went dark a LOT. Nice robe in closet for use in spa - size far too small for average guy like me, unless I wanted to flash the other guests, so no spa for you. I decided to try and get some work done - wireless NOT free (don't buy the dodge about 'free wireless in the lobby' - you get one hour and your machine is locked out by MAC address, contrary to staff's hopeful fibs, besides I paid for a ROOM to work in). Not willing to cough up $15 a night (!) for likely awful service I resorted to local Starbucks for my email and web support. After the event I worked, our team gathered for a drink in the bar - their 'best' single-malt scotch? Glenlivet. Waiter had no idea what any of the other truly good malts were - and took 15 mins to deliver one drink with the lounge virtually empty. Motivation obviously pretty low despite the tony ambiance. The lobby was filled with ear-hurtingly-loud boom-boom disco music even in the morning... not sure what that says about the place. My guess is the manager was on vacation. Combine that with the must-have-room-card-to-access-elevator (for every single guest - some trips took nearly five minutes to go through the foolishness of card-in/punch floor) and the 1960s style (ie hideous) furniture with lots of sharp corners (ow) and I felt very unwelcome. The Holiday Inn in Fremont made me feel so much more welcome - and was far less than half the price.

Reviews.Title: “New and Nice”
Reviews.Author: Tipster2000
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights at the nearly new JW Marriott Los Angeles at LA LIve. That last tag refers to the hotel's location in the new restaurant and entertainment complex connected with the Staples Center and the LA Convention Center. It is only a few hundred feet out the back door of the hotel to the Staples Center and a bit further to the convention center. On week days the hotel was primarily occupied by convention goers with name badges. This upscale hotel is very nice and I thoroughly enjoyed my stay. I had an executive king on the 17th floor. This room category is somewhat larger than a standard room. On the two days when the air was clear I had a spectacular 180-degree view all the way to Santa Monica, including the Hollywood sign and the Griffith Observatory. On the two hazy days the view lost its special appeal. Below was the I-110 freeway which I, surprisingly, never tired of looking at. The Santa Monica freeway was visible in the distance so I could judge how free-flowing or clogged the freeways were. The room was well insulated for sound and the freeway noise was only a low hum which was not objectionable and seldom noticed. There were two large view windows in the main room and a third large view window in the bath. Because there are no nearby buildings I left the blinds up except to sleep. The bath is large with a very large shower. There is no tub. There was lots of storage space and closet space. The room came with a safe and a robe, but no slippers. The TV is 42-inch. There was a large desk facing one of the windows which provided a pleasant place to work night or day. Room lighting was excellent and some lights had dimmers. There was a fairly comfortable lounge chair. The restaurant was good for breakfast. I found ordering from the menu was cheaper than having the buffet. I ate one dinner in the restaurant and found it fine. There are many other restaurants within one block. Everything looks relatively new. The hotel decor is modern. The public spaces are loud, but my room was quiet except for the freeway hum. Valet parking is $40 per night which is steep. The valet service was very good. Internet access is $12.95 per day. The internet connection was excellent. This hotel is costly, but it is a very pleasant place to stay, especially if you are going to the Staples Center or convention center.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: lolyaypotatoes
Reviews.Content: I cant really fill this space up with enough information i was only there one night but this hotel is SUPER AWESOME!!! the staff and everybody are very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent but pricey treat!”
Reviews.Author: dexter619
Reviews.Content: I had been wanting to stay at this hotel (or the adjoining Ritz Carlton) since I saw it being built on my frequent trips to LA. Excellent! I knew that it being a JW Marriott was going to cost me a pretty penny if I wanted to stay here. My husband and I stayed overnight as a surprise for his birthday. We stayed in a corner suite that was quite spacious, very hip and beautifully decorated with nice views of downtown. The front desk lady even escorted us to the elevators while giving us her 2 minute introduction of the hotel amenities; she was actually quite flirty with my husband which was interesting, but whatever.... The lobby is very open and inviting since its a thruway to all the LA Live stuff just outside the door. I invited about 2 dozen of my husbands friends to meet us in the lobby area for some drinks. There wasn't even a need to reserve any of the lobby areas since its so open and spacious, there was plenty of seating. Breakfast was also delivered to us in the morning and it was delicious. We were able to enjoy the pool and the bar that had music. The bill was pretty high at the end of our weekend, but I didn't expect anything different because of the brand and the location. I'd probably stay again if I wanted to splurge for a weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Good Value”
Reviews.Author: saintlouisan
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights while attending a conference and have no complaints. I paid $235 per night (before tax) which seemed reasonable for LA. Very nice, large room with nice touches like motion activated night light in the bathroom. Good bed and linens. Since there was no meal on my flight, I was hungry at arrival and got a nice sandwich at the shop in the lobby for only $6.50 - much less than I expected. The immediate neighborhood is nice, with about a dozen (mostly chain) restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Location location”
Reviews.Author: Moonstonemoclips
Reviews.Content: Visited Staples Center with kids to watch basketball and hockey. Superb location. Designer style evident in the hotel and area. Check-in was slow, but the room was very clean and well presented. All facilities of course brand new. Staff a little standoffish, but I would certainly return. Paid $200 inc tax and breakfast for a night which for the location was excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: YorktownBob
Reviews.Content: This was the host hotel for a gymnastics meet my daughter had at the LA Convention Center. Our entire family had a great time. From the check-in, to the helpful concierge everything went well. We are going back the next time we are in LA. Look for special rates we paid $123 per night but some people were paying three times that for the same type of room.

Reviews.Title: “Fun hotel with lots of excitement all around!”
Reviews.Author: MissFloridaForever
Reviews.Content: This is a newer hotel, so everything is nice and new. Comfy rooms and beds. Great views of downtown LA/Staples Center. Love the bathrooms, the shower was great. But you can hear everything, so if you are staying with someone you can't be shy if you know what I mean. Fast, express elevators - so that is nice when you are in a hurry. You need your key to access everything, including the elevators. Lovely pool area - quiet and relaxing. Lots of places to eat and things to do in the general area. Hotel store/pantry is SO OVERPRICED. A small bag of chips is almost $7 - I wish I was kidding. Internet costs almost $13 a day, ridiculous. All in all a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and great property”
Reviews.Author: thomasc5
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the downtown location. Staff was friendly. Room very clean. It didn't feel like being in a hotel with the lobby. Very clever furnishing. All and all great experience

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING hotel right in front of LA LIVE !!”
Reviews.Author: Sharma9
Reviews.Content: I do not have words for this hotel. Location = Excellent. It's located right in front of LA LIVE, with things to do as bowling, shopping, cinemas! Service = Excellent. Beds= SOOO comfortable. Staff = friendly & courteous. > I only had a small argument with the housekeeping staff, as it took them far too long to bring extra towels. But rest! 5 star luxury at it's best ! I recommend this hotel to all my friends and family and will DEFINITELY go back!

Reviews.Title: “Fun Location”
Reviews.Author: VTtraveler4
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 days at the LA Live Marriott Hotel for a conference. The location was great. Several excellent restaurants just a short walk away as well as a huge movie theater, The Grammy Museum, The Staples Center, and Nokia Theater (where the People's Choice and Grammy Awards are held). We got to look down on the Justin Beiber movie premire and witness a "red carpet" fisthand, which was a great education. The hotel itself is great, with modern, funky decor and very helpful, attentive staff. The only drawbacks of the trip were the double beds in the rooms and the fee for internet. They should have queen beds, and wireless should not have cost $13 a day-ridiculous!. One day when I went upstairs to grab my phone between sessions, the housekeeper was there, and she stopped me and made me prove I had the key to the room, which I really appreciated. I also enjoyed the wine bar in the lobby and the fair prices at LA Market restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “what you'd expect from Marriott but...”
Reviews.Author: LeFlorentin-Mougins
Reviews.Content: ...far from everything, no free wi-fi in the rooms (12.95$ / day), food not that great.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Facility, But Problems w/Billing Persist”
Reviews.Author: romadaro
Reviews.Content: As the heading states, this is absolutely a fabulous facility, but make sure you check your bill constantly throughout your stay if you booked a package deal. For some odd reason, this hotel isn't able to track the different packages offered and, in some cases, the staff isn't familiar with the deal, which just adds to the confusion. This happened in my case, but fortunately I had a printed copy of the rate rules for the deal that I had booked through the Marriott website, so they were able to make the necessary adjustments without any problem. But, of course, it was annoying to see the charges (rate included breakfast for two) and then have to provide proof of the rate details to get them adjusted. Of all the Marriott's I've stayed in as a Platinum MR member, I've never encountered this before to the extent that the hotel offers so many different packages that the hotel staff is oblivious to the details of many of the offers and asks for proof from the guest. I'm sure they get lots of push back considering the level of clientele staying in this hotel, but in my case since I had printed the reservation details and had a copy, it eliminated an argument. So, just keep an eye on your bill and make sure you print a copy of the details....just in case!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: yvrlocalgal2
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough a good things about the hotel and its staff. The hotel rooms are spacious and modern. The beds were very comfortable and the rooms were quiet. Our room had a big HD flat-screen TV which we enjoyed for watching a movie. The staff were very polite and service oriented. All the staff were very pleasant and obliging: the check-in/ check-out, the concierges, and the wait staff in the restaurant. The food in the restaurant was well-prepared. It was a pleasure to stay at this hotel. I would stay there again. I went with friends to a conference at the LA Convention Center. The Marriott at LA Live is just across the street from the Center and the Staples Center so it was incredibly convenient. When we wanted a break between events, we just went back to our rooms to relax. At the same time, it was exciting to be at the center of things because there was a lot of activity around the sports events at the Staples Center at night. Although the hotel has a lot of amenties I cannot evaluate them. We did not use the pool or sports centre

Reviews.Title: “package deal? clear up charges before you leave”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaOntheGoMom
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because we were looking to make a quick getaway to celebrate our anniversary and wanted to eat at a good restaurant and just unwind. I found the "LA Dine" package on the LA Dine week website but after visiting the hotels website I found the "Red Package Deal" which included valet parking, $100 credit and $40 breakfast credit, sounded pretty good right? It was a good deal I won't deny it. We pulled up on a busy Saturday night, and we were promptly greeted by Valet. We headed to the registration desk and check in was extremely fast and the girl who checked us in was great. She explained everything that was going, Circus in town, LA kings were playing, etc and did we want tickets to anything? reservations to the restaurant? Told her we were good and for a minute I almost thought she was going to walk us to the elevator when I asked for direction on how to get there. Room? Nice...Quiet.....We checked out the pool area? Nice but we were too cold to jump into the spa. Yes I know wimpy Californian. The fitness center? boy did it smell good in there! We headed to LA Market for dinner, our waiter was a little slow but all his recommendations were excellent. (Our bill for an appetizer, two entrees, bottle of wine and dessert + tip $124) Yep I used by $100 credit here. We headed to LA Market for breakfast and the lobby was a lot quieter than the night before so our breakfast was relaxing and opted for the buffet. The nice thing about this, is that the have the basics at the buffet but we could order other items such as omelets but we settled for fresh pancakes because really? who wants soggy pancakes sitting in a chafing dish? Now here is where you need to double check your bill before you leave and thank goodness for room check out via your TV because by bill was over $500 yet my package was $389...I debated if I should just wait until I got my bill via email or take care for it on the spot which is exactly what I did since they were charging me the full amount for dinner and breakfast. I made a quick call and had $140 removed from my bill but really should I have even dealt with this in the first place? Its a great location, I wont deny it. Would I stay again? yes

Reviews.Title: “nice downtown hotel - didn't feel like a marriott”
Reviews.Author: oakforest2
Reviews.Content: I usually stay in boutique hotels in NYC, Vegas and in LA. We used miles to stay at the Marriott for this trip. The hotel is very modern and clean - and we loved facing the mountains. The rooms are very quiet and comfortable. One of the staff members said it was the most money spent on any Marriott hotel. Well......that seemed a bit like a stretch. Rooms were nice, with refrigerators for use, flat screen TV and couch. Bathroom nightlight sensor was a nice touch - But the bathroom could have been slightly nicer (shower curtains aren't my favorite). The beds were nice, and I loved the down duvet and flat pillows. To pay $12/day for internet access (that can only be used by 1 person at a time) was unacceptable when there was free wifi in the lobby, and from what I could tell, the Ritz next door had free internet - Marriott, get with the times an upgrade to free wifi. The valet parking was $40/day - yikes! But you picked your car up at a carpeted lobby right off the main hotel lobby, and could call down ahead so it was waiting for you. LA live was a great addition. Being in downtown LA isn't the greatest if you aren't going to the Staples Center, but we had dinner at Katsuya (one of the 8 or so restaurants), went ice skating and bowling - all within a few hundred feet of our hotel. The gym was beautiful, large, and had personal TV's on all of the machines. I would say the only hotel gym that I have been to that beats it is at the SLS hotel in Hollywood. Rooftop pool was beautiful too! This hotel definitely feels modern and upscale. It had moments that reminded you it was a Marriott, but they were few and far between. I would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful LA Experience”
Reviews.Author: la_walt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for four nights over the New Years Holiday, as we were doing the Rose Bowl experience. I was very happy about almost all aspects of the hotel. The staff was always friendly and courteous, the hotel was meticulously cleaned, the restaurant was very good, etc. The only thing my husband and I didn't think was five stars was the bed. We both had a hard time sleeping due to the firmness of the bed. Of course, some people might really like that. Other than that, it was a fabulous weekend getaway, whose location cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “One "LIVE" Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RPS080
Reviews.Content: My son and I came to LA to see the Kings in the Staples Center and chose the JW Marriott due to it's location. I wasnt aware of the whole LALive scene and it really added alot of glamour to our experience. The hotel it self was fantastic. Large comfortable, clean rooms, and the staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful whether I was at the front desk or exploring the grounds. The TCU football team was staying here for their appearance in the Rose Bowl and the atmosphere was very electric. We had a great holiday experience!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy New Hotel”
Reviews.Author: avodoc
Reviews.Content: When we entered our room my wife said "Isn't this the grooviest room ever." With retro furnishings Austin Powers would feel right at home with and ultra chic touches everywhere, this place really screams DESIGNER. I found it all a little sterile but functional and comfortable none-the-less. Fortunately, they got all the important things right. It was quiet, the bed was comfortable, there was a 42" HD TV, they had a nice ipod dock radio/alarm clock, the bathroom was spacious and the shower was nice and hot. We ate at the restaurant in the hotel and it was quite good. There is a real scene in the bar on the weekends and it is in the middle of everything LA Live has to offer. I would skip the $38 a day valet parking, there are plenty of much cheaper parking options within a block or two of the Hotel, plus, even though I called 15 minutes ahead to have my car ready, I still had to wait another 15 minutes for it to be brought up. Finally, it really irks me that this hotel charges $12.95 a day for wireless. Hotels that charge less than half what this hotel costs include it in their nightly rate.

Reviews.Title: “Get it while it's hot!”
Reviews.Author: KenVicLee
Reviews.Content: The hotel was an afterthought. I was taking my wife to an early Christmas present; the Mark & Brian (local KLOS radio personalities) Christmas Show at the Nokia Theater. We live 40 miles away but decided that since we had not been to the L.A. Live area since it opened, we would stay in town to explore and to avoid the midnight commute home. I did not realize this hotel had only opened in February 2010. I did not know it was connected by plaza to the Nokia Theater (and right across the street from Staples Center). I was not aware of all of the restaurants available in the plaza (Fleming's, The Yard House, ESPN Zone, Trader Vic's). I was very impressed. But not nearly as much as I was by the hospitality at the J. W. Marriott. The reception was prompt and efficient. The room was pristine and clean. The amenities were better than most. The experience was exceptional. HIGH POINTS: Good value for the dollar in an exceptional location for any event at Staples Center, the Nokia Theater or L.A. Live. Staff is efficient yet when it was time to go to our room, they walked us to the elevator. The rooms are as clean as a whistle. The valet parking was easy. To pick up your car you have to go to a basement level...again, very efficient. LOW POINTS: When their informal restaurant closes from 2:00 pm to 5:00 pm, they direct you to their lobby bar. We ordered a couple drinks and a hummus plate. After waiting half an hour (and while others were served) my wife went back to the room to get ready for the evening and I insisted my waitress bring me the bill, absent the charge for food we never received. She had to get a manager to approve that....another couple minutes went by. The manager finally appeared, apologized, and explained someone had failed to show up for their shift. She thanked me for my patience. I felt that was not enough. Absent that underwhelming experience, our stay at the J. W. Marriott was a pleasant one. After my wife was all dolled up we used the interior passage in the hotel to go through to the adjoining Ritz Carlton and took their elevator to the WP24 Lounge. The "WP" stands for Wolfgang Puck and the "24" stands for the 24th floor. We had drinks and appetizers before going to our show.

Reviews.Title: “Best Trained Employees of Any Hotel I've Stayed”
Reviews.Author: maltasr
Reviews.Content: As the title says, this hotel has the most quality employees I've ever seen at any hotel. When I arrived by car, the valet personally escorted me to the front desk, introduced me to the agent behind the counter, and informed us he would help us with anything within his domain. The gal behind the counter said that because I was a Platinum Elite, they had reserved a junior suite that was corner located. We had a terrific view of the Staples Center, Nokia Center, Restaurant Row including Wolfgang Puck's upscale establishment. The view also included the large near-Olympic sized pool, 18 person jacuzzi, and several very large and private pool cabanas. Our junior suite measured 700 square feet which is quite large by most hotel standards. The hotel included a large dining room called "The Market" which seated 150 diners for breakfast, lunch and dinner and was quite good. It was also very busy, particularly in the evening when a lot of LA residents came into town for a look at the new LA Live complex. There was also an upscale coffee house and a very large cocktail lounge that featured live music nightly. I was on the Concierge Level so got to partake of the great breakfasts, snacks, and desserts. There were also several Lenovo computers in the lounge that guests could use. I had a conference rate of $120/night which is far below the rack rate of around $300. I don't know how the company was able to negotiate such attractive rates although they did reserve one thousand rooms. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great palce to rest your head”
Reviews.Author: Roughrider5208
Reviews.Content: What a great location. Next to the Nokia Center and Staple Center. Something going on there ALL THE TIME. Lots of resaurants and bars near by. Never have to leave the area for entertainment. The hotel in top of the line. Everything about it is TOP NOTCH. Great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious and peaceful, with highly efficient staff”
Reviews.Author: KCSF
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for it's proximity to the shuttle stop and finish line of the L.A. Rock n' Roll marathon. I was extremely impressed by the efficiency of the check-in staff. They identified customers as soon as they walked into the general area of the check-in desks and quickly ushered them to a desk for assistance. This is how all hotels should operate! Travelers are tired by the time they get to a hotel and the last thing you want to do is wait 15-minutes to check in. The hotel and the room did not disappoint. Everything in the room was modern, brand new and sparkling clean. There was a huge amount of storage in a hallway cabinet, ceiling height armoire and an empty fridge for storing your own food and drinks. This is a hotel you can stay in for a long trip and have enough space to store all your possessions. The bathroom was gorgeous and had an oversized bathtub. My room faced the pool and a large neon sign with blinking lights. I was concerned at first, but the curtains blocked out the lights and the windows did not let any sound in. The beds were comfortable and I had a great night's rest. There are too many dining and entertainment options to mention in the LA Live complex, and in the lobby there is a great illy coffee shop. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointed by the service”
Reviews.Author: tazosaure
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice, clean, chic hotel but it being a Marriott/4 stars I was a bit disappointed by the service at times. I was traveling for business as I was attending a conference at the next door conference center, and my wife was accompanying me as she wanted to enjoy/discover downtown LA. The good: rooms have top of line amenities (flat screen HD TV, iPod alarm clocks, etc) really comfortable beds and beautiful bathrooms. Besides the hotel's own restaurant there's plenty of good eateries right on the plaza, so no need to drive around! The valet parking staff were really nice and efficient. The bad: I had booked a king bed room but by the time we arrived (around 5pm on the sunday before the conference) they were fully booked and somehow no king room left besides my reservation. No apologies about it. I was told at the desk we would have 2 queens instead, which is fine by me as we sleep on a queen at home, but once in the room it turns out it was really 2 doubles. A bit tight for my wife and I, so we ended up sleeping in separate beds for the length stay, far from ideal... Apart from that first mishap, the bathtub's plug/drain stopper was not working making it impossible for my wife to relax from the trip in bath on the first night, no big deal but it took 3 requests (each spaced out by a couple of hours) to finally have someone come up and fix it. At checkout, we were rushed through, no one ever asked us how was our stay, I guess they didn't care, I was hoping to be able to voice my disappointment then but I was not given the opportunity so here you go.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at JW Marriot at LA Live”
Reviews.Author: birdmen1637
Reviews.Content: JW Marriot at LA Live is fantastic. Highly recommend it. Stayed there during the Gartner conference. The room was very spacious and nicely decorated. the big flat screen hd tv was an unexpected surprise. the bed was very comfortable. the room was quiet and I slept great. the LA Market restaurant in the hotel was really good. there's also a number of good restaurants near by. ate at ESPN Sportszone and Rock Fish, both of which were very good. the hot tub and pool were very nice. loved watching the projected tv images on the building from the hot tub at night. visible security in the hotel as well outside in the LA Live area so felt very safe.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome new facilities”
Reviews.Author: mojo2012oovajay
Reviews.Content: Fabulous new hotel with great rooms, very good food, convenient location (for Central LA, etc..), spacious up to date gym, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Business and Relaxtion”
Reviews.Author: CRGr8Escape
Reviews.Content: Service is very good, friendly, quick There are at least 8 people helping you as you step in to the hotel Many restaurants to choose from nearby The pool area is clean, quiet and only sometimes rowdy with people drinking inside the cabanas I was not happy that I called the concierge over and over and no one picked up The concierge room was very helpful (being a Marriott member) for the morning when we needed to grab breakfast, or stop in to read the paper and get a snack later on Everything is smooth - this hotel is huge and has excellent management behind it

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, great service, super clean.”
Reviews.Author: metaleyelash
Reviews.Content: I had forgotten a ladies' shaver and asked the hotel if they could bring one to my room. This was at 11pm and it was there in five minutes, along with a complimentary little can of shaving cream! I left the cleaning staff a $15 tip because they did such a great job for the three days that I was there. Expensive, but highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel and you are right in the middle of all the action”
Reviews.Author: Crowleymagic
Reviews.Content: Only 1 year old and it has that new modern look. Service was excellent from front desk to room service. You are in the heart of the LA Live scene with concerts, Lakers/Kings games and restaurants. Sitting out on the square and watching the people come and go is entertaining in itself. Hotel is very nice and complaints are minimal. Elevators are confusing and you have to use your room key every time (pain!); water pressure is not good in showers but I guess we are trying to be "green". Beds are great. If you are in LA for a show or game definitely stay here. Only other negative note for us is there is not a nice sit down restaurant. They are all "bars" that serve food. They todl us the steak restaurant did not make it and they are waiting for a new idea.

Reviews.Title: “Thank goodness I got to stay here instead of the Radisson!”
Reviews.Author: kathleen_1227
Reviews.Content: I was in town to attend a conference at USC. The conference said to stay at the radisson, so I made my reservation there. Days before the conference, I checked the Radisson reviews on Trip Advisor, and thank goodness I did. The reviews were HORRIBLE, so I quickly found another hotel near campus. Trip Advisor to the rescue! The JW Marriott is right next to the Staples Center and had a little promenade right outside the door with Times Square style bright lights. For me as a solo traveler, it was perfect. I hardly stepped out the door and I had a choice of about 10-12 restaurants. I got dinner at Wolfgang Puck one night and Rosa Mexicano the next. I felt totally safe those few feet outisde the hotel. My room was quite spacious and modern, and the bathroom was big with a beautiful shower and nice shampoo, conditioner, etc. Nice big flatscreen TV that didn't get great TV reception, but it wasn't a big deal. I used the gym both mornings and that was very nice too, down to providing towels, fruit water, and cardio machines with their own TV/iPod hookups. I didn't get to check out the pool or spa. My last morning, I went to get a cab to USC (about 2 miles away), and instead I got a complimentary ride from one of the two Marriott Escalades! I felt tlike a big cheese. For transportation betwen the hotel and LAX, Super Shuttle is only $16/way, whereas a cab is $47/way. As a business traveler, the Marriott was more than I was hoping for.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bjean
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott for USC parent's weekend. The hotel and room was extremely clean and well decorated. Staff was very helpful and friendly. The location was very conveinent. Lots of activilty going on in the LA live area, fun to get a drink or dinner at one of the outside tables of the restaurants and watch all the people. There are many restaurants in the downtown area just a 10 minute or so walk away. Neat rooftop bar and pool area and very nice fitness center! We will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best location for Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: dagnytaggart
Reviews.Content: Was here 3rd week in September for a Convention. Also stayed here twice earlier this year planning for the same event. Good points: It's more like a W than a Marriott, so the design is nice. Bed is pretty comfy. the weird one-arm orange couch in the room, also comfy. Bathrooms are nice with good amenities. I like the armoire and the little table at the front of the room with the coffee machine is a benefit. I like to finish the evening with a cup of tea, so it's nice to be able to do that. Big TV was also nice. Proximity to Starbucks is good. LA Live is great all around. The Wolfgang Puck is a stellar restaurant. Pricey, but stellar. Medicore points: Room service options aren't great. They were kind enough to give me extra water when they messed up my order, but the food was just OK. Desk is not all that workable a space. Not too comfy to sit at for long periods. Bad points: Overall hotel service isn't great. You have to ask for things over and over and over. It can get irritating. Can be pricey, both in terms of food and actual room price, because of proximity to the Convention Center. You can probably get more for your money if you don't stay so close. Restaurant in lobby is just OK. Bottom line--if you're going to a convention and can't afford the Ritz, this is the place. It's too close not to.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent downtown location - nice, new hotel”
Reviews.Author: KramerNashville
Reviews.Content: Excellent location beside the convention center, Nokia Center, and Staples Center. Trendy, nicely decorated and very clean room. An easy $16 Super Shuttle (www.supershuttle.com) ride from LAX; split a $60 taxi fare between colleagues on the return trip to LAX. Hotel restaurant takes reservations for breakfast, which is a must, especially considering how SLOW the service was, but the food was good. Several nice restaurants within easy walking distance, including a very busy Starbucks as a quick alternative for breakfast, instead of the expensive SLOW hotel restaurant. Nice fitness center with plenty of weights, treadmills, elipticals, etc. Awesome looking rooftop pool, which I didn't have the opportunity to use. Didn't need parking, but it is very expensive at $38. Also, passed on the daily internet rate of $12. Adjacent to Ritz Carlton. No better location if you have a convention at the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean place”
Reviews.Author: blue_alto
Reviews.Content: The Marriott was really a fantastic facility. While I would not have immediately chosen to stay downtown had this not been for a business conference, the location was convenient to lots of restaurants and some entertainment. While the Metro was not entirely convenient, this seemed to be a fairly safe area to walk (I even went for a run alone at 6:30 a.m. two mornings, and I'm fairly slightly built woman). Free water was a nice touch, and conference accommodations and food were out of this world! Nice, spacious rooms and bathrooms, and the hotel overall seemed quite to this light sleeper. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “best location in town”
Reviews.Author: tumorim
Reviews.Content: Right at the heart of LA live, and walking distance to all the theaters, restaurants, convenience stores, the Staples center and LA live, etc. The hotel per se is in quite modern style and is maintained very clean. Living in a high floor (>20 floors) should get you a pretty good city view of the surrounding area. Overall it is a great place for business travel in town.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: MarkCWales
Reviews.Content: I was filled with dread -- a convention hotel is usually pretty mediocre. This one was fantastic. The staff were friendly from check in to check out and, mostly, very efficient (it took 2 calls and 30 minutes to get foam pillows but that was the only flaw). I had expected the usual deliberately-dowdy Marriott too but this hotel was smart, contemporary and looked very slick Rooms were excellent -- quiet, comfortable and with proper duvet covers on great beds. Even the room service and laundry prices were reasonable. Although $35 a day for parking is a little steep -- I wish I had noticed the lot across the street Very, very impressive

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel next to Staples Center”
Reviews.Author: hqstir
Reviews.Content: Stayed over Labor Day weekend for concert at Staples. One block to Staples and convention center; 3 blocks to downtown. New, spacious rooms with frig and safe. Beds were nice and comfy and room was very quiet (maybe cuz hotel not that busy?). Lobby is airy and has free wi-fi! Unfortunately, no free wi-fi in rooms. 4th floor pool was nice and overlooked LA Live. Draft beer at bar was $8 but soda from vending machines were only $1.25! Valet parking is expensive but no free parking in area.

Reviews.Title: “Block Rooms”
Reviews.Author: shamaticgrl
Reviews.Content: In late July 2010 and all of August JW Marriott and I formed a contract for a block room for SM Town LA 2010. I set up 21 rooms and JW had said they would arrange the rooms to be on the same floor and provide us with 2 double beds since there wil be 78 people arriving for the concert. I called in 5 days prior the check in date and they told me everything was fine and all rooms are ready and early check in was fine as well. Once I got there all our rooms were scattered throughout the hotel. One room was on the 11th floor, 3 rooms on the 12th, 8 rooms on the 16th and 1 room was on the 19th floor. I called our event manager but they never picked up or responded back to me as usual since their schedule is from Monday-Thrus.
